title: Probabilistic Multi-Label Classification with Sparse Feature Learning.
abstract: Multi-label classification is a critical problem in many areas of data analysis such as image labeling and text categorization. In this paper we propose a probabilistic multi-label classification model based on novel sparse feature learning. By employing an individual sparsity inducing l1-norm and a group sparsity inducing l2,1-norm, the proposed model has the capacity of capturing both label interdependencies and common predictive model structures. We formulate this sparse norm regularized learning problem as a non-smooth convex optimization problem, and develop a fast proximal gradient algorithm to solve it for an optimal solution. Our empirical study demonstrates the efficacy of the proposed method on a set of multi-label tasks given a limited number of labeled training instances.
